poem:
**Unseen Damage**  

In the corridors of youth, he wore a helmet  
stamped with dreams, each collision a silent contract—  
unwritten, spiraling.  

Now, headlines echo louder than his voice,  
unweaving the synapse of a past game.  
A damaged mind, unmarked footsteps in a city,  
ending in a burst of darkness, unexplained,  
yet understood.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Shane Tamura, who was 27 and played football in high school, had “unambiguous diagnostic evidence” of low-stage chronic traumatic encephalopathy, the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
